org.dblp.mmdb

Class PersonName

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dblp.mmdb.PersonName
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<PersonName>

    public class PersonName
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<PersonName>
    A class representing a person name in dblp records of any type.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Person pers
      The person record associated with this name.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PersonName

        public PersonName(java.lang.String name)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  InvalidPersonNameException
        Creates a new person name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if name == null.
        InvalidPersonNameException - if an irregular name has been given.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name(boolean withHomonymId)
        Get the complete name string.
        Parameters:
        withHomonymId - If true, the homonym id number will be given, otherwise it is dropped.
        Returns:
        The name string.

      • name

        public java.lang.String name()
        Get the complete name string, including any possible homonym numbers.
        Returns:
        The name string.

      • coreName

        public java.lang.String coreName()
        Returns a reduced string representation of the name with all abbreviated name parts, suffices, homonym numbers, etc stripped away.

        E.g.:

        • "Wei Wang 0017" will be returned as "Wei Wang"
        • "Alfred O. Hero III" will be returned as "Alfred Hero"
        Returns:
        A reduced name string.

      • first

        public java.lang.String first()
        Get the first name(s) of this name. Note that this method does not necessarily classify first names correctly, but according to the conventions in dblp.
        Returns:
        The first name string, or null if this name does not have a first name.

      • last

        public java.lang.String last()
        Get the last name of this name. Note that this method does not necessarily classify last names, but according to the conventions in dblp.
        Returns:
        The last name string.

      • suffix

        public java.lang.String suffix()
        Get the name suffix (i.e., Jr., III, etc.) of this name.
        Returns:
        The name suffix string, or null if this name does not have a name suffix.

      • idnr

        public java.lang.String idnr()
        Get the 4-digit homonym number of this name.
        Returns:
        The homonym number, or null if this name does not have such a number.

      • urlpt

        public java.lang.String urlpt()
        Get the dblp URL part of this name.
        Returns:
        The URL part.

      • csFacetId

        public java.lang.String csFacetId()
        Returns the CompleteSearch facet identifier string of this name.
        Returns:
        The CS facet ID.

      • setPerson

        protected void setPerson(Person pers)
        Associates the given person record with this person name.
        Parameters:
        pers - The person record.

      • getName

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getName()
        Deprecated. Use name() instead.
        Get the complete dblp name string, including any possible homonym numbers.
        Returns:
        The name string.

      • isHomonym

        public boolean isHomonym()
        Checks whether this is a explicitly disambiguated homonym, that is, a name with a 4-digit homonym number at its end.

        Note that the base person name of a family of homonymous names (e.g., "Wei Wang" for "Wei Wang 0001", "Wei Wang 0002", and so on) will evaluate to false since it is not an explicitly homonymous name.

        Returns:
        The base name string.

      • hasPerson

        public boolean hasPerson()
        Checks whether there is a person record associated with this person name.
        Returns:
        true if a person record is associated, otherwise false.

      • getPerson

        public Person getPerson()
        Get the person record associated with this person name, or null if no person record has been associated with this name.
        Returns:
        The person record.

      • getPrimaryName

        public PersonName getPrimaryName()
        Get the primary name of this person. That is, if this person name has no person record linked, or if this person name is the primary name of the linked person, then this method will return a pointer to this person name. Otherwise – i.e., f this is an alias name – the primary person name of the linked person record will be returned.
        Returns:
        The primary person name.

      • isPrimary

        public boolean isPrimary()
        Checks whether this is a primary name of a person in dblp, or an alias name.

        If this person name has not been associated with a person record using setPerson(Person) before calling this method, this method will always return false.

        Returns:
        true if this is a primary name, otherwise false.

      • hasAliases

        public boolean hasAliases()
        Checks whether this person name has alias names in dblp. If no person record is associated with this name this method will always return false.
        Returns:
        true iff this person name has alias names in dblp.

      • getAliases

        public java.util.Collection<PersonName> getAliases()
        Retrieves all alias names of this person name, minus this name. If no person record is associated with this name this method will always return an empty collection.
        Returns:
        The alias names minus this name.

      • isAliasOf

        public boolean isAliasOf(PersonName other)
        Checks whether this name and the other name are aliases of the same person in dblp.

        If either of the given person names has not been associated with a person record using setPerson(Person) prior to calling this method, this method will return true if and only if both name strings are equal.

        Parameters:
        other - The other person name.
        Returns:
        true if both names are aliases of the same person, otherwise false.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(PersonName other)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<PersonName>

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
